data.title: Mrs
data.text:
Beautiful facility .. lots of parking, easy to get around to the right hall.
Seats are comfortable and sound was good.

data.title: Spectacular architecture and terrific performance
data.text: We drove over 50 miles to see Bernadette Peters and were not disappointed. Arrive early to get parking.

data.title: Looking around
data.text: The center has many thing going on that I have been to so if you see something you are interested in I would recommend you go and enjoy it.

data.title: Always enjoy coming here
data.text:
Last time we came I was in a wheelchair chair because of  a recent accident, we had received tickets as a gift before the accident and  were concerned as I would not have been able to get to our seats.  The box office was excellent and provided us with accessibility seats for no extra charge.
The parking attendant was excellent as well.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: So I have to admit that I brought the kids here as something to get teenagers away from their electronics for a couple of hours. And because it's free:-) There were a few really cool exhibits that we really enjoyed. The place is absolutely beautiful. We roamed around the campus and enjoyed ourselves. We will definitely be back to try out the theater as well as take in a glass blowing class!  It made for a very fun afternoon!

data.title: The Monkees
data.text:
I had the pleasure of attending my first concert at the MAC on 9/15.  The show was great.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The seats though, I'm a petite individual and they were super small.  Larger people will be rather uncomfortable at least in the floor seats (I was in the 2nd row).  I had a great view for the show.  At the end of the concert, I exited to my left but unfortunately, that led out of the theater so I did not pass the merch table.  Because of where I was, I didn't think I would be able to get back to lobby area as the crowd would be moving toward the exit door.  In the future I will purchase my souvenirs before the show.

Parking was where ever you could find it on the city streets.  I did not know this ahead of time (I was expecting a parking garage on the premises) so I was a little concerned as I left my car in the lot.  Thankfully, the car was there when I returned.  It was a straight shot from the theater back to my car, however it was very dark down the street/alley I walked down (I attended the show solo).  The city might want to add additional lighting especially for concert evenings.

data.title: The Nutcracker
data.text: Unique approach to an old story.  Most of the misic was traditional, as was the whole story.  But there were three numbers that had a twist on the dance, as they had performers who were trained in Flamenco dance style.  The program was fabulous from the Ballet Etudes.

data.title: Lord of The Dance
data.text: This was an excellent concert that theatre where it was held was awesome .would go there again if the right performers were there

data.title: Farnsworth Studio Theatre
data.text: This is an intimate theater space that is part of the Mesa Arts Center complex.  It has excellent sight lines - not a bad seat in the house - and good acoustics.  We saw a performance of "Or" by the Southwest Shakespeare Company and they were excellent (including the "roving" minstrels that did a pre-show in the lobby (not great acoustics there, unfortunately).  There is a food and drink place if you need something at intermission (drinks can be brought back into the theater), and there is plenty of free parking.

data.title: Just wandering
data.text: The architecture is delightful! Inspiration without even going inside. Beautiful fountains, lawns and buildings.

data.title: great place
data.text: Went there to see our granddaughter sing with the   B YU singers from  Provo, Utah. Great night.They will probably go on tour in the spring again.  Br sure and go to the concert. Well worth your time if you love good singing.

data.title: Amazing Sound
data.text: Mesa concert venue has best surround sound in Phoenix area since the redesign of Frank Lloyd Wright's building ruined sound.  I have been to numerous concerts at venue and always have enjoyed clear surround sound.  Smaller venue with limited access to best seating area for ADA seats.  Get center seats as close to stage as possible for concerts and go early to get parking and have time to enjoy the surrounding outdoor area.  Downer is limited and paid parking.

data.title: Wonderful venue
data.text: I have been to the Mesa Arts Center several times;  once to attend an MCC nursing school graduation, a couple times to see plays/musicals, once to see Riverdance and we're going again in October to see Paula Poundstone. The theaters were the appropriate size each time for each activity, the acoustics were great, and the seating was perfect. It's easy to park there, and the entire place is just beautiful!

data.title: Great venue with great parking
data.text: My husband and I have seen two events at the Mesa Art's Center.  We are always pleasantly surprised at the beautiful location, the friendly staff, and the great choices of events. Full snacks and drinks are available for a reasonable prices.  We have not been disappointed yet and we will continue to visit events at this location. I recommend looking at all the seating options when buying your tickets.

data.title: excellent venue
data.text: Seating in each of the theaters is excellent. Sound is above normal for these type of venues. Mesa Arts center feels like a more intimate experience for top name artists

data.title: Good place to go for theater arts and music concerts
data.text:
I  have seen several musical theater and dramas in two of the theaters there. I have been to several arts and crafts fairs held in and around the center on most weekends.  Take a bottle of water with you if you go for the walk in the summer. It gets very hot there. 
If  you happen to go there on Second Fridays of the month, there is a street fair in central Mesa by the Arts Center. There are street performers, local bands, and the restaurants have some good fare and ambiance. 
If you are interested in antiques, this is the place and time to look for some old treasures and search for some good memories in your quest from things of yesteryear.  Enjoy.

data.title: Urban dance performance
data.text:
Love this place, we have a lot of dance competition inside and outside of the center.  Very clean and easy to get to.
The grounds are nice and a lot of parking.

data.title: Lyle Lovett
data.text: This is an intimate concert venue that seats only about 1500 people.  Acoustics are great and I love being able to see the performer's in such a close setting.  Parking is easy and access is great as well.  This is a great treasure on the east side of the valley.

data.title: Great venue
data.text: Saw Jackson Browne here and very impressed with sight lines and acoustics. Very intimate venue with no bad seats.  Sat in mezzanine balcony and the chairs are less comfy than regular seats, but being able to move them to adjust viewing angle is handy.

data.title: Concert
data.text: I not only saw Tower of Power there a few years ago, but performed there with my band. The sound is terrific and the acoustics as well.
